link:labelLink.link:label: Business Segment

The BAS_Business_Segment [BasBusSg] and the BAS_Business_Segment_Hierarchy [BasBusSgHrchy] have been designed to tabularize the portions of an organizational chart that is reflected in the business transactions as structural units e.g. business unit, department, cost center and project).The fields within the BAS_Business_Segment [BasBusSg] are used to capture the individual organizational unit represented by each box on an organizational diagram.
Business Segment Code
Code for each business segment.
Business Segment Name
Name of the business segment.
Segment Reference Level
Relative level of the segment, with 1 being the consolidated level and the numbers increasing through the lower levels of the organizational chart.
Organization Type Name
Indicates the name of the organization type (e.g. department, cost centre).
Business Segment Hierarchy

The fields in the BAS_Business_Segment_Hierarchy [BasBusSgHrchy] are used to capture the relationships between the individual organization units. The table assumes a one to one relationship and captures the data necessary to consolidate transactions occurring for child level organizational units into higher level organizational structures (for example, business unit to division).
Parent Code
Code for the parent business segment.Shall match the Business_Segment_Code [BusSgCd] in the BAS_Business_Segment [BasBusSg] table.
Child Code
Code for the child business segment.Shall match the Business_Segment_Code [BusSgCd] in the BAS_Business_Segment [BasBusSg] table.
Employee
Contains the personnel information of the employee in an independent accounting unit.
Employee ID
Unique identifier for an employee. Typically auto-generated by the system.
Employee Code

Code for the employee. Each employee has only one code. If someone has part-time jobs in multiple departments, there will be more than one record with different Employee_ID [EmpId] in this table. The part time status will be reflected in Employee_Type_Code [EmpTypCd].
Employee Name
The name of the employee.
Inactive Flag
Indicates whether one employee is active or inactive.An employee can become inactive due to various reasons (e.g taking a sabbatical).
Employee Type Code
Code for the employee type. EXAMPLE 004 is an on-the job employee, 005 is a retired employee, 006 is a deceased employee, 007 is a part-time employee.
Employee Type Name
Name of the employee type. EXAMPLE Employed, retired, probation, part-time.
Department Code
Code for department rosters. EXAMPLE The department name is IT department, the code is 0018. Shall match the Business_Segment_Code [BusSgCd] in the BAS_Business_Segment [BasBusSg] table.
Employee Job Title
Job title of the person in an accounting unit.EXAMPLE Accounting manager.
Employee Academic Degree
Highest academic degree acquired.EXAMPLE Doctor, Master.
Employment Date
Employment date of the employee.
Termination Date
Termination date of the employee from which the labor contract was no longer valid, or the employee no longer works in this department.
Recorded
System user ID associated with the employee. Shall match the User_ID [UserId] in the BAS_User [BasUser] table.
User
Contains the user information of accounting and/or ERP system.
Identification

Unique identifier for individuals entering transactions into the accounting and/or ERP system.Typically auto-generated by the system.This field is used to join information in this table to other tables based on fields such as Created_User_ID, Last_Modified_User_ID, Approved_User_ID and Posted_User_ID.
User Active Status
Indicates whether the status of the user is active or inactive.A user can become inactive due to retirement, dismissal or termination, etc.EXAMPLE 1 is active, 0 is inactive.
User Status Modified Date
Modified date of the user's activation or termination status.
User Name
Name of the user.
User Job Title
Job title of the person in the system.EXAMPLE System manager.
Department Code
Code for department rosters.EXAMPLE The department name is IT department, the code is 0018.Shall match the Business_Segment_Code [BusSgCd] in the BAS_Business_Segment [BasBusSg] table.
User Role Responsibility
Free-form description of the individual's functional role or primary responsibility.EXAMPLE Responsibility related to managing the information of AP in the system.
Customer Type
Contains detailed descriptions of the customer type.
Identification
Unique identifier for the customer type. Typically auto-generated by the system.
Customer Type Code

Code for the customer type.EXAMPLE 004 is a platinum customer, 005 is a gold customer, 006 is a silver customer. Customer_Type_Code [CustTypCd] and Customer_Type_Name [CustTypNm] are not necessarily related.
Customer Type Name
Name of the type categorized by the customer attributes.EXAMPLE Platinum customer, gold customer, silver customer.
Parent Customer Type ID
Unique identifier for the parent customer type.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Customer_Type_ID [CustTypId] in the BAS_Customer_Type [BasCustTyp] table.
Customer
Contains essential and generic information of the customers.
Identification
Unique identifier for the customer. Typically auto-generated by the system.
Customer Account Number
Number of the customer. This number is either generated by manual input or generated by the system.
Customer Account Name
Name of the customer.
Customer Abbreviation
Abbreviation of the customer's name.
Parent Customer ID
Unique identifier for the parent customer.Shall match the Customer_Account_ID [CustAcntId] in the BAS_Customer [BasCust] table.
Corresponding Supplier ID

Unique identifier for the corresponding supplier in cases where the customer is also a supplier.Shall match the Supplier_Account_ID [SuplAcntId] in the BAS_Supplier [BasSupl] table. Otherwise, set NULL.
Customer Type ID
Unique identifier for the customer type.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Customer_Type_ID [CustTypId] in the BAS_Customer_Type [BasCustTyp] table.
Customer TIN
Customer's tax identification number.This number is usually generated by a tax regulator.
Inactive Date
Date when the customer was declared inactive.A customer can become inactive due to exceeding their credit limit, legal restrictions, contract termination or bankruptcy.
Transaction Credit Limit
Per invoice credit limit established for this customer.
Total Credit Limit
Credit limit for this customers total outstanding balance.
Terms Discount Percentage
Discount percentage the customer can take if an invoice is paid before a certain number of days.In the flat file, terms are represented as integers to a decimal place.EXAMPLE 10 % is 0.10.
Terms Discount Days
Number of days from the invoice date that the customer has to take advantage of discounted terms.Terms are represented as integers with no decimal places.EXAMPLE 10 days are 10.
Terms Due Days
Default number of days allowed to meet the obligation before an invoice becomes overdue.
Physical Address
Physical address information.
Billing Address
Billing address information.
Primary Contact
Primary contact information.
Responsible
Information about the data that was created into the system.
Responsible
Information about the data was approved within the system.
Responsible
Information about the data was last modified within the system.
Supplier Type
Contains detailed descriptions of the supplier type.
Supplier Type ID
Unique identifier for the supplier type. Typically auto-generated by the system.
Supplier Type Code
Code for the supplier type.EXAMPLE 004 is preferred suppliers, 005 is key suppliers, 006 is common suppliers.
Supplier Type Name
Name of the type categorized by the supplier attributes.EXAMPLE Preferred supplier, key supplier, common supplier.
Parent Supplier Type ID

Unique identifier for the parent supplier type.EXAMPLE Raw material supplier is a parent type of iron supplier.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Supplier_Type_ID [SuplTypId] in the BAS_Supplier_Type [BasSuplTyp] table.
Supplier
Contains essential and generic information of the suppliers.
Supplier Account ID
Unique identifier for the supplier to whom payment is due or from whom unused credits have been applied.Typically auto-generated by the system.
Supplier Account Number
Number of the supplier to whom payment is due or from whom unused credits have been applied.This number is usually generated by manual input or is generated by the system.
Supplier Account Name
Name of the supplier.
Supplier Abbreviation
Abbreviation form of the supplier's name.
Parent Supplier ID
Unique identifier for the parent supplier.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Supplier_Account_ID [SuplAcntId] in the BAS_Supplier [BasSupl] table.
Corresponding Customer ID

Unique identifier for the corresponding customer in cases where the supplier is also a customer.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Customer_Account_ID [CustAcntId] in the BAS_Customer [BasCust] table. Otherwise, set NULL.
Supplier Type ID
Unique identifier for the supplier type.Typically auto-generated by the system.Shall match the Supplier_Type_ID [SuplTypId] in the BAS_Supplier_Type [BasSuplTyp] table.
Supplier TIN
Supplier's tax identification number.This number is usually generated by the tax regulator.
Supplier Group
Supplier group assignments when the organization segments the suppliers.
Inactive Date
Date when the supplier was declared inactive.A supplier can become inactive due to exceeding their credit limit, legal restrictions, contract termination or bankruptcy.
Transaction Credit Limit
Per invoice credit limit established for this supplier.
Total Credit Limit
Credit limit for the total outstanding balance approved for the supplier.
Terms Discount Percentage
Discount percentage the supplier can provide if an invoice is paid before a certain number of days.In the flat file, terms are represented as integers to a decimal place.EXAMPLE 10 % is 0.10.
Terms Discount Days
Number of days from the invoice date that the supplier allows the customer to take advantage of discounted terms.Terms are represented as integers with no decimal places.EXAMPLE 10 days is 10.
Terms Due Days
Number of days allowed to meet the obligation before an invoice becomes overdue.
Physical Address
Physical address information.
Billing Address
Billing address information.
Primary Contact
Primary contact information.
Responsible
Information about the data that was created into the system.
Responsible
Information about the data was approved within the system.
Responsible
Information about the data was last modified within the system.
Chart Of Accounts

Contains the information about GL accounts, including name, description, type and hierarchy. This table is level 1. When it is cross-referred by other table(s), consistency shall apply. For example, in this table, the value of GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr] is 101, the value of GL_Account_Name [GlAcntNm] is cash, and the value of Balance_Debit_Or_Credit is D. If the value of GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr] in GL_Trial_Balance [GlTrialBal] table is 101, then the Amount corresponding with cash account (101) must be debit.
GL Account Number
Number of the GL account.
GL Account Name
Name of the GL account.
GL Account Description
Label or description associated with the GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr].
FS Caption
Financial statement caption that represents a related group of accounts.EXAMPLE Cash and cash equivalents, AP, cost of sales.The caption can be at the trial balance level.
Account Type
Type of account.EXAMPLE Assets, liabilities, equity, revenues, expenses.
Account Subtype
Subtype of the account.EXAMPLE Current assets are the subtype of assets.
Account Hierarchy
Corresponding level for account number in the account hierarchy.EXAMPLE 1 is assets, 2 is the account subtype current assets.
Parent GL Account Number

Number of the parent account in an account hierarchy.This is provided to allow more than the predefined levels of the hierarchy in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts [BasChartOfAcnts] table.When Parent_GL_Account_Number [ParGlAcntNr] is the highest level, its value can be set to the default value (e.g. set to NULL).Shall match the GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr] in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts [BasChartOfAcnts] table.
Balance Debit Or Credit Code

Indicates whether the natural balance of the account is a debit or credit balance by indicating D or C, where assets and expenses have a natural balance of debit, and liabilities, equity and revenues have a natural balance of credit.
Active Flag
Indicates whether the GL account is active or inactive.EXAMPLE 1 is active, 0 is inactive.
Specified
Contains associated Business Segment information.
Accounting Period

Contains information related to the accounting period, including corresponding fiscal year, beginning date and ending date. The table captures the time range within a specific reporting period and year, in which business transactions and entries are accumulated into financial statements and other reports.
Accounting Period Code
Accounting period in which the calendar date occurs.EXAMPLE W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-M12 for monthly periods, Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods, from any beginning date to any ending date.
Fiscal Year
Fiscal year in which the calendar date occurs.The year shall be shown in four digits as YYYY, which is part of the extended format and the YYYY-MM-DD from ISO 8601-1.
Accounting Period BEG Date
Calendar beginning date of the current accounting period.
Accounting Period Ending Date
Calendar ending date of the current accounting period.
Trial Balance

Contains all the ledger account balance information of the ADCS. The GL_Trial_Balance [GlTrialBal] file shall contain the ending balances at a point in time. The GL_Trial_Balance [GlTrialBal] should be extracted at the same time as the GL_Details [GlDtls] to prevent differences in transactions and balances.
Identification
GL Account Number
Number of the GL account. This number is often generated by the system.Shall match the GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr] used in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts [BasChartOfAcnts] table.
Fiscal Year

Fiscal year in which the Balance_As_Of_Date [BalAsOfDt] occurs.The year shall be shown in four digits as YYYY, which is part of the extended format and the YYYY-MM-DD from ISO 8601-1. Shall match the Fiscal_Year [FiscYr] in the BAS_Accounting_Period [BasAcntingPer] table.
Accounting Period Code

Accounting period in which the Balance_As_Of_Date [BalAsOfDt] occurs.EXAMPLE W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-M12 for monthly periods, Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods, from any beginning date to any ending date.Shall match the Accounting_Period [AcntingPer] in the BAS_Accounting_Period [BasAcntingPer] table.
Balance As Of Date
Date through which the provided balance reflects account activity.EXAMPLE If a report is run for activity through 2014-12-31 on 2015-01-22, the date recorded will be 2014-12-31.
Functional Currency Code
Code of the functional or group currency (in accordance with ISO 4217).Shall match the Currency_Code [CurCd] in the BAS_Currency [BasCur] table.
Transaction Currency Code
The code of currency used in the actual transaction (in accordance with ISO 4217).Shall match the Currency_Code [CurCd] in the BAS_Currency [BasCur] table.
Reporting Currency Code
The code of currency used for non-consolidated reporting (in accordance with ISO 4217).Shall match the Currency_Code [CurCd] in the BAS_Currency [BasCur] table.
Local Currency Code
The code of currency used for local country reporting requirements (in accordance with ISO 4217).Shall match the Currency_Code [CurCd] in the BAS_Currency [BasCur] table.
Functional Balance
Balance amount recorded in the functional or group currency.
Transaction Balance
Balance amount recorded in the transaction currency.
Reporting Balance
Balance amount recorded in the reporting currency.
Local Balance
Balance amount recorded in the local currency.
Functional Balance
Balance amount recorded in the functional or group currency.
Transaction Balance
Balance amount recorded in the transaction currency.
Reporting Balance
Balance amount recorded in the reporting currency.
Local Balance
Balance amount recorded in the local currency.
Business Segment Code
Contains a code to identify the associated business segment. Must match the Business_Segment_Code [BusSgCd] in BAS_Business_Segment [BasBusSg].
Segment Reference Level
Number or text to keep the Business Segments in a predefined order.
Business Segment Type Name
GL Header

Contains all of the journal entry details for each transaction (e.g. associated journal entry ID, associated account number, debits or credits associated with the journal entry line). This table should be at the journal entry line level.
Journal ID
Unique identifier for each journal entry.Typically auto-generated by the system.
Journal Number
Number of the journal entry (e.g. including serial number, document type, date).
Fiscal Year

Fiscal year in which the Effective_Date [EffectiveDt] occurs.The year shall be shown in four digits as YYYY, which is part of the extended format and the YYYY-MM-DD from ISO 8601-1.Shall match the Fiscal_Year [FiscYr] in the BAS_Accounting_Period [BasAcntingPer] table.
Accounting Period Code

Accounting period in which the Effective_Date [EffectiveDt] occurs.EXAMPLE W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-M12 for monthly periods, Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods, from any beginning date to any ending date. Shall match the Accounting_Period [AcntingPer] in the BAS_Accounting_Period [BasAcntingPer] table.
Source Code

Code for the source from which the journal entry originated.EXAMPLE Sales journal, cash receipts journal, general journal, payroll journal, accountant manual entry, spreadsheet.Shall match the Source_Code [SrcCd] in the GL_Source [GlSrc] table.
Journal Entry Header Description
Description of the entire journal entry as described by the journal entry header.
Effective Date

Date of the journal entry, no matter when the entry is received or created.This sometimes refers to the accounting date or accounting effective date.EXAMPLE If the user wants to see the financial results for the period ending March 5, 20XX, the journal entry may be created on any day during the open period and be assigned to the period ending March 5, 20XX.
Included
GL Details
Journal Line Number
Number of the line within a journal entry.This number is generated either by manual input or by the system.
Journal Entry Type Code
Code for the journal entry type.Shall match the JE_Type_Code [JeTypCd] in the BAS_Journal_Entry_Type [BasJrnEntryTyp] table.
GL Account Number
Number of the GL account.Shall match the GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr] used in the AS_Chart_Of_Accounts table.
Credit Debit Indicator
Indicates whether the amount is a credit or a debit.EXAMPLE C is credit, D is debit.
Journal Entry Line Description
Description of the individual line within the journal entry.
Bill Number

Number of the bill.A bill usually includes bank drafts, promissory notes and checks. A bill may be issued by the drawer who agreed upon themselves or entrusts the drawee at sight. A specified date to the payee or bearer unconditionally pays a certain amount of securities.This number is generated either by manual input or by the system.
Bill Type Code
Type of bill.EXAMPLE Bank drafts, promissory notes, checks.Shall match the Bill_Type_Code [BillTypCd] in the BAS_Bill_Type [BasBillTyp] table.
Bill Date
Date of the bill.
Quantity
Quantity of items referenced in the journal entry line.When the GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr] is for inventories or fixed assets, this field is effective. If not, this field is NULL.
UOM Code
Code for the physical measurement scale for the inventory and PPE referred to as a "unit of measurement (UOM)".Shall match the UOM_Code [UomCd] in the BAS_Measurement_Unit [BasMeaUnit] table.
Unit Price

Per unit price of the inventory or PPE.This field is associated with Quantity and Amount.EXAMPLE If the account is inventory or PPE, Quantity can be multiplied by Unit_Price [UnitPrice] to get total line Amount.
Settlement Method Code

Code value or indicator of the settlement method used for cash receipt from customers (i.e. sales) and cash payment to suppliers (i.e. purchase).EXAMPLE Check, wire transfer, cash.Shall match the Settlement_Method_Code [SetlMthdCd] in the BAS_Settlement_Method [BasSetlMthd] table.
Reversal Indicator

Indicates whether this entry is a reversal or to be reversed.EXAMPLE 1 is the entry is a reversal, 2 is the entry is being reversed, an empty (" ") is none of the above or system-generated indicators.
Reversal Journal ID
When the Reversal_Indicator [RevInd] = 1, this field identifies the Journal_ID [JrnId] of the entry being reversed.
Cancellation
Sign of cancellation of a journal entry already formed but not yet posted.EXAMPLE 0 is entry is not cancelled, 1 is entry is cancelled.
Account Segment Employee

Fixed account segment, recording information related to an employee (e.g. loan to corporate officers).The value stored in this field stored is Employee_ID [EmpId].Shall match the Employee_ID [EmpId] in the BAS_Employee [BasEmp] table through GL_Account_Segment [GlAcntSg].
Account Segment Project

Fixed account segment, recording information related to a project.EXAMPLE Construction projects that require separate accounting.The value of this field stored is Project_ID [ProjId].Shall match the Project_ID [ProjId] in the BAS_Project [BasProj] table through GL_Account_Segment [GlAcntSg].
Account Segment Bank Account

Fixed account segment, recording information related to bank accounts.The value of this field stored is Bank_Account_Number [BankAcntNr]. More information about a certain bank account can be obtained from the BAS_Bank_Account [BasBankAcnt] table.Shall match the Bank_Account_Number [BankAcntNr] in the BAS_Bank_Account [BasBankAcnt] table through GL_Account_Segment [GlAcntSg].
Functional Amount
Amount recorded in the functional or group currency.
Functional Currency Code
Code of the functional or group currency (in accordance with ISO 4217).Shall match the Currency_Code [CurCd] in the BAS_Currency [BasCur] table.
Transaction Amount
Amount recorded in the transaction currency.
Transaction Currency Code
The code of currency used in the actual transaction (in accordance with ISO 4217).Shall match the Currency_Code [CurCd] in the BAS_Currency [BasCur] table.
Reporting Amount
Amount recorded in the reporting currency.
Reporting Currency Code
The code of currency used for non-consolidated reporting (in accordance with ISO 4217).Shall match the Currency_Code [CurCd] in the BAS_Currency [BasCur] table.
Local Amount
Amount recorded in the local currency.
Local Currency Code
The code of currency used for local country reporting requirements (in accordance with ISO 4217).Shall match the Currency_Code [CurCd] in the BAS_Currency [BasCur] table.
Ctrated By
The unique identifier for the person who did the activity. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the User_ID [UserId] in the BAS_User [BasUser] table.
Created On
The date of activity. This should be a system generated date (rather than user-created date), when possible. This is sometimes referred to as the creation date.
Created At
The time of activity.
Approved By
The unique identifier for the person who did the activity. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the User_ID [UserId] in the BAS_User [BasUser] table.
Approved On
The date of activity. This should be a system generated date (rather than user-created date), when possible. This is sometimes referred to as the creation date.
Recorded By
The unique identifier for the person who did the activity. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the User_ID [UserId] in the BAS_User [BasUser] table.
Account Segment
Contains associated Account Segment information.
Business Segment
Contains associated Business Segment information.
Source

Contains additional information about the sources provided in the GL_Details [GlDtls] table. Each source shall include a description of the ERP system or accounting package, from which the data is extracted, and information related to the business process the data represents.
Source Code

Code for the posting source (code for the source from which the journal entry originated).EXAMPLE Sales journal, cash receipts journal, general journal, payroll journal, accountant manual entry, spreadsheet.The code shall be a unique indicator for the underlying source.
Source Description
Description of the source system.
ERP Subledger Module

Description of the subledger or ERP module from which the journal entry originated.This should tie back to a system or significant accounting process. In some instances, it can be represented by the source system.
System Manual Identifier
Indicates whether the journal entry is system-generated or manually-entered.EXAMPLE S is system-generated, M is manually-entered.
Business Process Major
Major class of transaction associated with a business process.EXAMPLE Sales.
Business Process Minor
Sub-process of a major business process.EXAMPLE Orders, returns, discounts.
Account Segment

Contains the code and name for the account segment, as well as the GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr] to which the account segment is related. Account Segment provides additional information for particular GL_Accounts (e.g. the AR contains the information regarding supplier, customer, employee, and project). Such information would be treated as an Account Segment below A/R, thus resulting in a lengthy account structure. The Account Segment structure is therefore defined as a set to record related information, which efficiently stops account names and numbers from becoming too long and too complex. Account Segment is more flexible to capture the complicated information.Some of the most frequently used account segments (e.g. project, employee, bank account) are defined as fixed fields in tables, such as GL_Details [GlDtls]. These segments are called "fixed account segments" in the document. Fixed account segments and other customized account segments are covered in this table.
GL Account Number
Number of the GL account. This number is generated either by manual input or by the system.Shall match the GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr] used in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts [BasChartOfAcnts] table.
Account Segment Number

Number of the Account_Segment.Case 1: If the value of this field is 0, the record is used to explain a fixed account segment that is distinguished by the Account_Segment_Name [AcntSgNm] of the record.Case 2: If the value of this field is 5, the record is used to explain the No.5 field of Account_Segment_X, named Account_Segment_5 in the tables, such as GL_Details [GlDtls].This number is generated either by manual input or by the system.
Account Segment Name

Name of the Account_Segment.Case 1: If the value of the Account_Segment_Number [AcntSgNr] of the record is 0, the field contains the name of a fixed account segment, such as Account_Segment_Employee [AcntSgEmp].Case 2: If the value of the Account_Segment_Number [AcntSgNr] of the record is 5, the field value should be the name of a customized account segment, such as welfare expenditure.
Corresponding File

Table corresponding to the account segment. Case 1: If the value of the Account_Segment_Number [AcntSgNr] of the record is 0, the field contains the table name corresponding to the fixed account segment, such as BAS_Employee [BasEmp] for Account_Segment_Employee [AcntSgEmp].Case 2: If the value of the Account_Segment_Number [AcntSgNr] is larger than 0, and no other table besides BAS_Customized_ACC_Segment [BasCstmzdAccSg] contains the basic information of the customized account segment, the field value should be BAS_Customized_ACC_Segment [BasCstmzdAccSg].Case 3: If the value of the Account_Segment_Number [AcntSgNr] is larger than 0, and there is a table containing the basic information of the customized account segment, the field value should be the table's name, such as BAS_Customer [BasCust].
Account Segment Description
Detailed description of the Account_Segment_Name [AcntSgNm].
Customized ACC Segment Code
Code for the customized account segment.Shall match the Customized_ACC_Segment_Code [CstmzdAccSgCd] in the BAS_Customized_ACC_Segment [BasCstmzdAccSg] table.
Created
Information about the data that was created into the system.
Ctrated By
The unique identifier for the person who did the activity. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the User_ID [UserId] in the BAS_User [BasUser] table.
Created On
The date of activity. This should be a system generated date (rather than user-created date), when possible. This is sometimes referred to as the creation date.
Created At
The time of activity.
Approved
Information about the data was approved within the system.
Approved By
The unique identifier for the person who did the activity. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the User_ID [UserId] in the BAS_User [BasUser] table.
Approved On
The date of activity. This should be a system generated date (rather than user-created date), when possible. This is sometimes referred to as the creation date.
Posted
Information about the data that was posted.
Recorded By
The unique identifier for the person who did the activity. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the User_ID [UserId] in the BAS_User [BasUser] table.
Address
Address information
Street Address1
Line 1 of the street address.
Street Address2
Line 2 of the street address.
City Name
City name of this address.
State Province Code
The state or province of this address (in accordance with ISO 3166-2).
Postal Code
Zip or postal code of this address.
Country Code
The country code of this address (in accordance with ISO 3166-1).
Contact
Contact information.
Name
Name of the contact.
Phone
The phone number of the contact.
Email
The email address of the contact.
Monetary Amount
Functional Amount
Transaction Amount
Reporting Amount
Local Amount
Currency Code
Functional Currency Code
Transaction Currency Code
Reporting Currency Code
Local Currency Code
Business Segment

The BAS_Business_Segment [BasBusSg] and the BAS_Business_Segment_Hierarchy [BasBusSgHrchy] have been designed to tabularize the portions of an organizational chart that is reflected in the business transactions as structural units e.g. business unit, department, cost center and project).The fields within the BAS_Business_Segment [BasBusSg] are used to capture the individual organizational unit represented by each box on an organizational diagram.
GL Details
Account Segment

Contains the code and name for the account segment, as well as the GL_Account_Number [GlAcntNr] to which the account segment is related. Account Segment provides additional information for particular GL_Accounts (e.g. the AR contains the information regarding supplier, customer, employee, and project). Such information would be treated as an Account Segment below A/R, thus resulting in a lengthy account structure. The Account Segment structure is therefore defined as a set to record related information, which efficiently stops account names and numbers from becoming too long and too complex. Account Segment is more flexible to capture the complicated information.Some of the most frequently used account segments (e.g. project, employee, bank account) are defined as fixed fields in tables, such as GL_Details [GlDtls]. These segments are called "fixed account segments" in the document. Fixed account segments and other customized account segments are covered in this table.
Business Segment

The BAS_Business_Segment [BasBusSg] and the BAS_Business_Segment_Hierarchy [BasBusSgHrchy] have been designed to tabularize the portions of an organizational chart that is reflected in the business transactions as structural units e.g. business unit, department, cost center and project).The fields within the BAS_Business_Segment [BasBusSg] are used to capture the individual organizational unit represented by each box on an organizational diagram.
